dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 2578 IH: Drug Testing for Special Government Employees Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Sherrill introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To require drug testing for special Government employees, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited at the Drug Testing for Special Government Employees Act.

section.header: Mandatory drug testing for special Government employees in sensitive positions

subsection.text: Before the first day of service as a special Government employee at an agency, the head of such agency shall require the individual proposed to be such an employee to undergo a drug test in accordance with the Mandatory Guidelines for Federal Workplace Drug Testing Programs.

Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the head of each agency shall require any special Government employee in a sensitive position at the agency on the date of the enactment of this Act to be entered into a random drug testing program in accordance with the Mandatory Guidelines for Federal Workplace Drug Testing Programs.

paragraph.text: Any individual who tests positive for a controlled substance pursuant to subsection (a) shall be ineligible for an appointment as a special Government employee for a period of not less than 12 months beginning on the date on which the head of the applicable agency determines that the test result was positive.

Any individual who tests positive for a controlled substance pursuant to subsection (b) shall be removed from the civil service and shall be ineligible for appointment as a special Government employee for a period of not less than 12 months beginning on the date on which the head of the applicable agency determines that the test result was positive.
the term controlled substance has the meaning given the term in section 101 of the Controlled Substances Act (21 U.S.C. 802);
the term agency has the meaning given the term in section 551 of title 5, United States Code, and includes the Executive Office of the President and the Office of Management and Budget;

the term sensitive position means any position who has been granted access to classified information, positions that could reasonably be expected to affect safety, security, National security, or functions other than the foregoing requiring a high degree of trust and confidence, and includes any individual performing in a position designated mission critical or performing mission critical duties; and
the term special Government employee means a special Government employee as defined by section 202 of title 18, United States Code.
